content.title: Supply of Radio to the Blind Persons
content.details: The scheme 'Supply of Radio to the Blind Persons' was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. In this scheme, a radio is provided to the blind person for recreation. In order to be eligible, the applicant should have disability of 40% or above, and should be a Native/Resident of the Union Territory of Puducherry for at least 5 years.
benefits: A radio is provided to the blind person for recreation.
eligibility: The applicant should be a Native/Resident of the Union Territory of Puducherry for at least 5 years.
The applicant should have disability of 40% or above.
The annual income of the applicant should not exceed ₹ 75,000/-.
documents_required: Residence-cum-nativity Certificate, Issued by the Competent Authority.

faqs.question: Is there a contact point for general inquiries regarding the scheme?
faqs.answer: For general inquiries, individuals can refer to the contact details at https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/contact-us.

faqs.question: Are there any sub-offices where applicants can seek assistance?
faqs.answer: Yes, sub-offices of the Social Welfare Department are listed at https://socwelfare.py.gov.in/sub--office-social-welfare-department.

faqs.question: What is the official platform for grievance redressal related to the scheme?
faqs.answer: Grievances can be addressed through the official portal at https://pgportal.gov.in.

faqs.question: What is the specific purpose of providing radios to the blind beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Radios are provided for recreational purposes.

faqs.question: Can someone from outside Puducherry apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only those who are Native/Residents of the Union Territory of Puducherry for at least 5 years are eligible.

faqs.question: How does one qualify as an eligible applicant for the scheme?
faqs.answer: To qualify, an applicant must be a resident of Puducherry for at least 5 years, have a disability of 40% or above, and an annual income below ₹ 75,000/-.

faqs.question: Is There Any Compensation For The Delay In The Disbursal Of The Scheme Benefits?
faqs.answer: The guidelines do not mention any provision for compensation in the event of delayed disbursement of scheme benefits.

faqs.question: Can Applicants From The Neighboring States/UTs Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme is exclusively available to permanent residents of the Puducherry.

faqs.question: Is there an application deadline for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme guidelines do not mention any opening date or closing date for applications.

faqs.question: Are there any specific provisions for Transgenders under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No provisions for Transgenders are mentioned in the guidelines of this scheme.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No, applicants can rest assured that the entire application process is entirely free of cost.
